messages.subject: Re: Off Topic question
messages.msgSnippet: Deb, I also read/reply through yahoo online instead of e-mail. I followed Jenny s directions with the yahoo e-mail address that is associated with my account.
messages.messageBody:
Deb, I also read/reply through yahoo online instead of e-mail. I
followed Jenny's directions with the yahoo e-mail address that is
associated with my account. It doesn't matter if you actually use that
e-mail address for anything but that's where you set the signature.
Here's her directions:
Go into you Yahoo mailbox and in the upper right, click on
"Options", then scroll down to "Signatures" under "Personalization"
and there ya go! Just make sure you click the little box when you
compose mail to use the signature.



--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Deb" <debra.rossing@m...> >
And if you don't use email but respond directly through Yahoo online?
> I couldn't find anything for that case.
>
> --Deb

This is typically an option of the email program you
use. So you'll have to find something that aol has.
The signature then appears on every email you send.

Manisha

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Off Topic question
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/28/2005 1:30:08 PM Eastern Daylight Time, billyandjoanne@yahoo.com writes: Does  anybody know how I can add a signature after my posts?
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/28/2005 1:30:08 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
billyandjoanne@... writes:

Does anybody know how I can add a signature after my posts? Does it
need to be typed in after every post or is there a way to have it show
up on it's own? I searched through all of the yahoo help pages but
can't find it.
Thanks!
Joanne



Yes there is! Go into you Yahoo mailbox and in the upper right, click on
"Options", then scroll down to "Signatures" under "Personalization" and there ya
go! Just make sure you click the little box when you compose mail to use the
signature.

Jenny
Homeschooling in Greenfield
Danny (12-1-99), Kelsey (11-1-01) and Evelyn (5-19-04)
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Education is not filling a pail but the lighting of a fire. ~William Butler
Yeats
